definition[0]: used to introduce a reason for what you have just said
example[0]: He couldn’t bring himself to say what he thought. For one thing, she seldom stopped to listen. For another, he doubted that he could make himself clear.
definition[1]: used to give one reason for something
example[1]: Well, for one thing, it’s too big.
example[2]: He’s not that wonderful. He’s bad-tempered for one thing.
